intro: Psychotria fleuryana, commonly known as the Fleury's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
